radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal anatomy without mass, midline-shift, hemorrhage, or infarction. The ventricular system and calvarium were unremarkable.
Normal cardiac profile, hyper-inflated lung volumes with flattened diaphragms, large left-sided pleural effusion, mild thoracic scoliosis, pectus excavatum, evidence of prior sternotomy.
Moderate aortic regurgitation and an ejection fraction of approximately 55%.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Evidence of moderate aortic regurgitation noticed 2 years before admission, previously stable cardiac function.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Paucity of intra-abdominal fat and ureteral diverticulum, but no structural anatomic variant of the upper abdomen.
No stricture, hiatal hernia, or inflammatory changes.
Markedly delayed and prolonged gastric emptying but no specific outlet obstruction.
